page.title: 02NORTH DERBY:LANDSCAPE
page.content: THIS BLOCK OCCUPIES A WEDGE OF ELEVATED LAND LYING WEST OF THE RIVER DERWENT AND EAST OF MARKEATON BROOK. THE HIGHEST LAND,146 METRES, IS FOUND IN THE NORTHERN PART OF QUARNDON VILLAGE, WHILE THE LOWEST LAND,AROUND 50 METRES LIES ALONG THE FLOOD PLAIN OF THE RIVER DERWENT. THE MAJORITY OF THE LAND, LYING ON SHALES, IS FAIRLY HEAVY WITH ABUNDANT SURFACE WATER. THE SANDY OUTCROPS CAPPING THE HIGHEST HILLS GIVE A DRY SITE FOR THE VILLAGE OF QUARNDON WHICH HAS GROWN INTO A STELLATED FORM ALONG THE RIDGES OF HIGHER LAND.WHILE THE NORTHERN PART OF THE BLOCK IS LARGELY AGRICULTURAL, THE SOUTHERN PART IS PREDOMINANTLY URBANIZED.
